intro: Lissocarpa, commonly known as the blueweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. The plants are characterized by their small, blue or violet flowers that are typically arranged in composite heads. Lissocarpa species often grow in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. They are generally herbaceous perennials with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves.
